alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 2:50AM EST until February 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. Pork Fork Cumberland River at Cumberland affecting Harlan County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Pork Fork Cumberland River at Cumberland. * WHEN...From early this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, River is at bankfull. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.7 feet this morning and then recede. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued by 3 PM EST.
